documents.text:
DOCUMENT: Field_Report_1.pdf

Field Report - May 01, 2025
City: Penonomé
On May 01, 2025, a transportation policy protest erupted in Penonomé, drawing approximately 709
demonstrators. The protest was largely peaceful, though tensions briefly escalated when law
enforcement attempted to redirect marchers away from government buildings. Protesters voiced
strong criticism of President José Raúl Mulino, accusing them of negligence and corruption.
Organizers stated their intent to continue demonstrations until their demands are addressed. No
major injuries were reported, but several participants were briefly detained for questioning. Further
developments are expected in the coming days.

DOCUMENT: Field_Report_10.pdf

Field Report - June 27, 2025
City: Boquete
On June 27, 2025, a anti-government protest erupted in Boquete, drawing approximately 554
demonstrators. The protest was largely peaceful, though tensions briefly escalated when law
enforcement attempted to redirect marchers away from government buildings. Protesters voiced
strong criticism of President José Raúl Mulino, Defense Chief Ana Rojas, accusing them of
negligence and corruption. Organizers stated their intent to continue demonstrations until their
demands are addressed. No major injuries were reported, but several participants were briefly
detained for questioning. Further developments are expected in the coming days.

Field Report - February 23, 2025
City: Aguadulce
On February 23, 2025, a student-led protest erupted in Aguadulce, drawing approximately 222
demonstrators. The protest was largely peaceful, though tensions briefly escalated when law
enforcement attempted to redirect marchers away from government buildings. Protesters voiced
strong criticism of Minister of the Interior Carlos Méndez, accusing them of negligence and
corruption. Organizers stated their intent to continue demonstrations until their demands are
addressed. No major injuries were reported, but several participants were briefly detained for
questioning. Further developments are expected in the coming days.
